intro: Dissochaeta pentamera, commonly known as the five-merous dissochaeta, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and opposite leaf arrangement. Its stems are often branched and covered with fine hairs. Dissochaeta pentamera is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
